U-19 World Cup: India to open campaign against USA on January 15; see full schedule
description: India's U-19 cricket team will kick off their 2026 World Cup campaign against the USA on January 15 in Bulawayo. The tournament, co-hosted by Zimbabwe and Namibia, features 16 teams across four groups. India is placed in Group A alongside the USA, Bangladesh, and New Zealand. India and Pakistan are not placed in the same group.

Verdict in absentia, empathy in short supply: Reading B'desh through its Hasina coverage
description: Bangladeshi media largely avoids sharp criticism following Sheikh Hasina's death sentence, instead adopting a matter-of-fact tone. Coverage reveals little empathy for Hasina, with minimal interrogation of her claims of a rigged tribunal. The nation's newspapers are discussing her downfall as a settled matter, shifting focus to the political vacuum she leaves behind.

title: ‘A stranger in our midst’: NASA’ Perseverance rover finds a desk-sized ‘exotic’ rock on Mars
PSL in trouble! Team owner who tore up notice, now threatens legal action on league
description: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen publicly claims the franchise is being excluded from the PSL's valuation and renewal process, citing a lack of response from league management. Tareen stated that despite multiple attempts through formal and legal channels, the team has received no communication, prompting a warning of potential legal action if the impasse continues.

Not Sachin, Kohli, or Dravid - Shai Hope becomes 1st batter to achieve this rare feat
description: Shai Hope's brilliant unbeaten 109 in a rain-shortened ODI against New Zealand wasn't enough as the hosts secured a five-wicket victory. Hope's century, his first against New Zealand, saw him equal Brian Lara's 19 ODI hundreds and become the first to score centuries against all Test-playing nations. He also surpassed 6,000 ODI runs.

Kolkata: Woman receives bullet injury in Howrah housing complex; husband detained
description: A woman was injured by a bullet grazed her neck inside a residential complex in Howrah's Shibpur area. Her husband claims the incident was accidental while cleaning his licensed firearm. Police are investigating the husband's statement and the circumstances of the firing.

description: Bihar's 2025 election results have triggered a significant crisis within the Rashtriya Janata Dal, leading to a dramatic drop in seats and exposing deep-seated family and organizational rifts.  The fallout includes public declarations of departure and accusations of gatekeeping, casting a shadow over the party's future stability and leadership.

Jaishankar opens two new consulates in Russia; hails Delhi-Moscow ties
description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday inaugurated two new Consulates General in Russia, Yekaterinburg and Kazan. This move marks a significant step in deepening India and Russia bilateral ties. The new missions will foster economic, technological, and scientific cooperation. They will also support the large Indian community residing in Russia.

Cambridge picks 'parasocial' as word of the year: What it means
description: Parasocial language has quietly reshaped how today’s youth think, learn, and plan their futures. What began as one-sided admiration has evolved into emotional outsourcing, where influencers and AI systems function as mentors, motivators, and confidants. This shift alters classroom engagement, blurs career expectations, and challenges students to distinguish digital intimacy from genuine connection.

Zoho One gets major overhaul with new AI features, revamped UX, and unified integrations
Can an AI run Google: CEO Sundar Pichai answers
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai believes artificial intelligence could eventually manage his role, calling the CEO position 'one of the easier things' for AI. He anticipates AI agents will handle more complex tasks independently within a year, acknowledging significant societal disruptions and job transformations. Pichai advises young people to embrace change, as AI will augment professions like teaching and medicine.

ED attaches 9 luxury Dubai properties worth Rs 51.7 cr; linked to bank fraud
description: The Enforcement Directorate has seized nine luxury properties in Dubai valued at over Rs 51 crore. These assets are linked to a massive Rs 1,266 crore fraud against the State Bank of India. The fraud allegedly involves Advantage Overseas Private Limited and its owner Shrikant Bhasi. Funds were siphoned off through shell companies and used to acquire these foreign assets.

description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed deep concern over the death of a Booth Level Officer in Jalpaiguri, attributing it to "unbearable pressure" from the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls.

RJD down to one-third, but its dynast MLAs remain, buck new House trend
An AI machine that passes the smell test
'Venomous rhetoric': Citizens pen letter against Rahul; accuse Cong of making unsubstantiated claims
description: A group of 272 eminent citizens, including retired judges, bureaucrats, and military officers, have penned an open letter criticizing Rahul Gandhi and the Congress for allegedly undermining constitutional bodies, particularly the Election Commission. The letter accuses the opposition of baseless rhetoric and "systematic and conspiratorial attacks" against the ECI, urging civil society to support the institution.

title: Bhopal: Over a dozen masked men vandalize cafe with no intention to loot; probe on
description: Masked assailants stormed a Bhopal café, vandalizing furniture with swords and sticks in a swift, violent attack. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are investigating the incident, suspecting personal enmity as the motive behind the unprovoked destruction.

title: F-35s, AI chips, and trillions: How MBS, once a ‘pariah’, took back Washington
description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, once a pariah, has made a remarkable comeback in Washington, securing significant US investment and military hardware.  His visit, marked by military fanfare and high-profile meetings, underscores Saudi Arabia's renewed strategic importance to the US, despite lingering human rights concerns. MBS skillfully leveraged geopolitical competition to his advantage.

title: Explainer: What to check before buying an air purifier; key features, common myths busted
description: Air quality impacts health, making air purifiers a household necessity. This guide explains how they work, the filters used, and key buying factors like CADR ratings. It debunks common myths and offers maintenance tips. Understanding costs and exploring alternative tech solutions like face masks are also covered. Proper selection and usage ensure cleaner indoor air for everyone.

title: Delhi car blast probe: Al-Falah University ‘raked in’ Rs 415cr from fees; new details emerge
description: Enforcement Directorate arrested Al-Falah group chairman Jawad Siddiqui.  Crores were allegedly siphoned off to family-linked companies.  Contracts for construction and catering were awarded to businesses owned by his wife and children.  The arrest follows a probe into financial irregularities and fraudulent practices.  The agency seized cash and digital devices during searches.

title: Gisele Bündchen says focusing on Tom Brady’s career took personal toll
description: Shannon Sharpe's podcast comments resurfaced, suggesting emotional fulfillment, not wealth, may have driven Gisele Bündchen's divorce from Tom Brady. Sharpe theorized that despite Brady's fortune, unmet needs for time and attention could have eroded their 13-year marriage. This perspective continues to resonate, highlighting that financial security alone cannot sustain relationships under pressure.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
description: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: 'Safe' trap: How 19 women were drawn into extremism by Dr Shaheen; all untraceable
description: Authorities are actively searching for 19 women from Kanpur and surrounding areas who were reportedly influenced by arrested Jaish-e-Mohammed operative Dr. Shaheen Shahid. Investigators believe these women were radicalized through her manipulative speeches and outreach network.  Efforts are underway to locate them using various tracking methods to understand Dr. Shaheen's full operation.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
description: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.
